description: Redevelopment of the site with a 3-storey residential building, containing 4x1 bedroom flats, 1x2 bedroom flats with frontage onto Acton Lane and a 2x2 bedroom duplex apartments in two-storey residential building to rear incorporating private garden space, communal amenity space, frontage soft landscaping and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plan: 4364/D/20, D/21, D/22, D/23 received on 11/06/2012.  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the residential units approved.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers,  in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 9.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of hard and soft landscaping to the front and rear of the site along with boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter. 	 REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and in the interest of highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: 'Trees and Development Guidelines' and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 5.10 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of noise mitigation including the noise exposure category, BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to works commencing on site. The details shall also include noise and vibration mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation and shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the residential unit and shall be retained thereafter.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of the future occupiers of property, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A to H (inclusive) of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) Order 2008, no additions / extensions of any kind, porches, outbuildings hardsurfacing within curtilage etc to the dwellings shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2011) and polices 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012). | Details of the internal layout and access routes shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Details must demonstrate satisfactory design to aim to meet with Lifetime Homes standards in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with such approved details.   Reason:  In the interests of inclusive design, in accordance with polices 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 3.8 of The London Plan (2011). | Before any works commence on site, a detailed soil survey to identify contamination and remedial measures shall be carried out and submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Any remedial measures that are identified as a result of the survey shall be carried out as approved before development commences.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2011). | The proposed ground floor windows in the rear elevation of units 6 and 7 of the building approved shall contain only obscure glass and be fixed shut and shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no residents of the flats nos. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 shall obtain resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 6.13 and 8.2 the London Plan (2011).
